metadata.title: CVE-2020-9494 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
Apache Traffic Server 6.0.0 to 6.2.3, 7.0.0 to 7.1.10, and 8.0.0 to 8.0.7is vulnerable to certain types of HTTP/2 HEADERS frames that can cause theserver to allocate a large amount of memory and spin the thread.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

trafficserver - 8.0.8+ds-1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 8.0.8+ds-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: trafficserver package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.8+ds-1').
